result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alejandro Ramirez

records.addlTxt:
9:18 AM; Case called for Status conference. Defendant Alejandro Ramirez in court.  Attorney Daniel P. Murray appeared by Zoom video for Alejandro Ramirez.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. Atty. Murray provides an update; as he was just appointed he needs time to review the case with his client.  Atty. Murray requests a further proceedings in about 45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order on Petition of Appointment of an Attorney.- Appointing Attorney Daniel P. Murray. (BC)
Proposed Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Alejandro Ramirez
Current: 421 South Grand Avenue, Waukesha, WI 53186   (Effective: 05-09-2022)
Prior: 619 Perkins Ave, Waukesha, WI 53186
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:19 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.
Defendant Alejandro Ramirez in court. 

Defendant is requesting appointment of counsel.
Defendant provided the petition paperwork.

Court swears in the defendant and conducts colloquy regarding his request for counsel.
Court Grants - Petition for Appointment of Counsel.
Court to appoint counsel.
Defendant to post $75 per month, starting 10/15/2022 and the 15th of every month until completed.

Next court date will be for status of counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Pre-trial conference on September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

USE CASH BOND ALREADY ON DEPOSIT.  RETURN ANY REMAIN CASH BAIL TO THE POSTER.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

03:17 PM Defendant Alejandro Ramirez in court with State Public Defender Law Intern, Erik Schleuter.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

EXT CODE 3.
BAIL JUMPING CASE: Waukesha County case 20CM530.

09:50 AM Defendant Alejandro Ramirez not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and forfeit bail.
The Court will issue a $1,000.00 arrest warrant and forfeit bail.
